name: spaghetti carbonara
ingredients: Spaghetti, Eggs, Pancetta, Parmesan Cheese, Black Pepper.
description: A classic Italian pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and pepper.
steps: Cook spaghetti in salted water until al dente.; In a bowl, whisk eggs and parmesan cheese together.; Cook pancetta in a pan until crispy.; Drain the spaghetti, reserving some pasta water, and add to the pan with pancetta.; Remove the pan from heat and mix in the egg mixture, adding pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.; Serve with a sprinkle of black pepper and extra parmesan cheese.

name: chicken tacos
ingredients: Chicken Breast, Taco Shells, Lettuce, Tomatoes, Cheese, Sour Cream,cheese.
description: A flavorful Mexican dish made with seasoned chicken, fresh toppings, and crunchy taco shells.
steps: Season the chicken with spices of your choice and cook until fully done.; Shred or slice the cooked chicken into small pieces.; Warm the taco shells in an oven or pan.; Assemble the tacos by adding chicken, lettuce, tomatoes, and cheese.; Top with sour cream and serve immediately.

name: caesar salad
ingredients: Romaine Lettuce, Caesar Dressing, Croutons, Parmesan Cheese
description: A fresh and crisp salad with romaine lettuce, creamy Caesar dressing, crunchy croutons, and a sprinkle of parmesan cheese.
steps: Wash and chop the romaine lettuce into bite-sized pieces.; In a large bowl, toss the lettuce with Caesar dressing until evenly coated.; Add croutons and sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese.; Serve immediately, optionally garnished with a lemon wedge.

name: pancakes
ingredients: Flour, Eggs, Milk, Baking Powder, Butter, Maple Syrup
description: Fluffy and golden pancakes, perfect for breakfast, served with syrup and butter.
steps: In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, and a pinch of salt.; In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, and melted butter.; Combine the wet and dry ingredients, mixing until just combined.; Heat a non-stick pan and pour a ladle of batter onto the pan.; Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook the other side until golden.; Serve warm with butter and a drizzle of maple syrup.

name: miso soup
ingredients: Miso Paste, Tofu, Green Onions, Seaweed, Dashi Broth
description: A comforting Japanese soup made with miso paste, tofu, and a flavorful broth.
steps: Prepare the dashi broth by boiling water and adding dashi granules or stock.; Lower the heat and dissolve miso paste into the broth using a ladle or strainer.; Add diced tofu and simmer for 2-3 minutes.; Sprinkle chopped green onions and rehydrated seaweed into the soup.; Serve hot as a side dish or starter.

name: avocado toast
ingredients: Bread, Avocado, Salt, Pepper, Olive Oil
description: A healthy and delicious toast topped with creamy avocado, seasoned with salt and pepper.
steps: Toast the bread slices until golden and crisp.; Mash the avocado in a bowl with a fork, adding a pinch of salt and pepper.; Spread the mashed avocado evenly over the toasted bread.; Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle additional pepper if desired.; Serve immediately as a snack or breakfast option.

name: margherita pizza
ingredients: Pizza Dough, Tomato Sauce, Mozzarella Cheese, Basil, Olive Oil
description: A simple yet tasty pizza with tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, and basil.
steps: Preheat the oven to the highest temperature (usually 250°C or 475°F).; Roll out the pizza dough to your desired thickness and place it on a baking tray.; Spread an even layer of tomato sauce over the dough.; Top with slices of mozzarella cheese and fresh basil leaves.; Drizzle with olive oil and bake for 10-12 minutes until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly.; Serve hot and enjoy!

name: dal tadka
ingredients: Toor Dal, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger, Garlic, Cumin Seeds, Mustard Seeds, Coriander
description: A popular Indian lentil dish cooked with spices and topped with a tempering of ghee and cumin seeds.
steps: Wash the toor dal and pressure cook it with water, turmeric, and a pinch of salt until soft.; In a pan, heat oil or ghee and sauté cumin seeds, mustard seeds, garlic, and ginger until aromatic.; Add chopped onions and tomatoes, and cook until the tomatoes are soft.; Mix the cooked dal into the pan and simmer for 5-7 minutes, adjusting the consistency with water if needed.; Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve with rice or roti.

name: vegetable biryani
ingredients: Rice, Mixed Vegetables, Spices, Yogurt, Onions, Tomatoes
description: Vegetable Biryani is a delightful and aromatic dish where long-grained basmati rice is cooked with a medley of fresh vegetables and fragrant spices. The addition of yogurt gives it a slightly tangy flavor, making it a wholesome and satisfying vegetarian meal.
steps: Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes, then cook it until 70% done and set aside.; In a pan, heat oil or ghee and sauté sliced onions until golden brown.; Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft, then stir in spices such as turmeric, cumin, coriander powder, garam masala, and chili powder.; Mix in the mixed vegetables (e.g., carrots, peas, beans, cauliflower) and cook until tender.; Add yogurt and simmer to create a thick masala base.; Layer the partially cooked rice over the vegetable mixture, sprinkle fried onions, mint, and coriander leaves, and cover with a tight lid.; Cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes (dum method) and serve hot with raita.

name: panner butter masala
ingredients: Paneer, Tomatoes, Butter, Cream, Spices
description: Paneer Butter Masala is a rich and creamy dish where soft paneer cubes are cooked in a velvety tomato-based gravy, infused with aromatic spices. The addition of butter and cream gives it a luscious texture, making it a favorite in Indian cuisine.
steps: Heat butter in a pan and sauté onions and garlic until translucent.; Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft, then blend into a smooth puree.; Return the puree to the pan and add spices such as turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, and coriander powder.; Simmer the gravy, then stir in cream to achieve a rich, creamy consistency.; Add cubed paneer and cook for 5-7 minutes, ensuring the paneer absorbs the flavors.; Garnish with a swirl of cream and serve hot with naan or rice.

name: chole bhature
ingredients: Chickpeas, Flour, Yogurt, Spices, Onions, Tomatoes
description: Chole Bhature is a classic North Indian dish comprising spicy and flavorful chickpea curry (chole) paired with soft, deep-fried bread (bhature). The combination is hearty and indulgent, perfect for a special breakfast or lunch.
steps: Soak chickpeas overnight, then pressure cook until soft.; In a pan, sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until golden, then add tomatoes and cook until mushy.; Add spices such as turmeric, cumin, coriander powder, garam masala, and chole masala, and cook the mixture into a thick gravy.; Mix in the cooked chickpeas and simmer for 10-15 minutes, adjusting consistency with water.; For bhature, knead a dough using flour, yogurt, and a pinch of baking soda. Let it rest for 30 minutes.; Roll out the dough into discs and deep fry until puffed and golden.; Serve the chole hot with freshly made bhature.

name: palak paneer
ingredients: Spinach, Paneer, Onions, Garlic, Tomatoes, Cream
description: Palak Paneer is a healthy and delicious dish where soft paneer cubes are simmered in a creamy spinach puree seasoned with garlic, onions, and a hint of cream. This dish is as nutritious as it is tasty, offering the goodness of greens and protein.
steps: Blanch spinach leaves in boiling water for 2 minutes, then immediately transfer to ice water to retain color.; Blend the spinach into a smooth puree and set aside.; Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until golden brown.; Add tomatoes and cook until soft, then mix in spices such as cumin, turmeric, and garam masala.; Stir in the spinach puree and simmer for 5-7 minutes.; Add paneer cubes and cream, cooking for another 2-3 minutes.; Serve hot with naan or steamed rice.

name: stuffed paratha
ingredients: Flour, Potatoes, Onions, Spices, Ghee
description: Stuffed Paratha is a versatile Indian flatbread filled with spiced mashed potatoes or other vegetable fillings. It is cooked on a hot griddle with ghee until golden and crispy, making it a comforting meal when served with yogurt or pickle.
steps: Boil and mash potatoes, then mix with chopped onions, spices (e.g., cumin, chili powder, coriander powder), and fresh coriander leaves.; Knead a soft dough using flour, water, and a pinch of salt. Let it rest for 20 minutes.; Divide the dough into small balls, flatten one ball, and add a portion of the potato filling.; Seal the edges and roll it out gently into a paratha.; Cook on a hot griddle, applying ghee on both sides, until golden brown and crispy.; Serve hot with yogurt, pickle, or chutney.

name: chicken biryani
ingredients: Rice, Chicken, Spices, Yogurt, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Green Chilies, Coriander, Mint, Ghee
description: Chicken Biryani is a flavorful one-pot dish where tender marinated chicken is layered with fragrant basmati rice and cooked with aromatic spices. The slow-cooking method ensures the chicken is juicy, and the rice is infused with a rich, savory flavor.
steps: Wash and soak the rice for 30 minutes. Cook until 70% done and set aside.; Marinate the chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, biryani masala, and salt for 30 minutes.; Heat ghee in a pot and add whole spices (bay leaf, cinnamon, cloves, cardamom). Sauté until aromatic.; Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Remove half for layering later.; Add chopped tomatoes, green chilies, and marinated chicken. Cook until chicken is tender.; Layer the partially cooked rice over the chicken mixture. Add fried onions, chopped coriander, and mint between layers.; Seal the pot with a lid and cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes (Dum cooking).; Serve hot with raita or salad.

name: butter chicken
ingredients: Chicken, Butter, Tomatoes, Cream, Garlic, Ginger, Cashews, Spices
description: Butter Chicken, also known as Murgh Makhani, is a globally loved Indian curry made with succulent pieces of chicken cooked in a creamy tomato-based gravy. The addition of butter and cream enhances its rich texture and mellow flavor, making it irresistible.
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, and salt. Set aside for 1 hour.; Grill or sauté the marinated chicken until cooked. Keep aside.; Heat butter in a pan, add garlic, ginger, and cashews. Sauté briefly.; Add pureed tomatoes and cook until oil separates. Add salt and spices (coriander, garam masala).; Blend the mixture into a smooth paste and return it to the pan.; Add grilled chicken pieces and simmer for 10 minutes.; Stir in cream and a knob of butter. Adjust seasoning.; Serve hot with naan or steamed rice.

name: mutton curry
ingredients: Mutton, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger, Garlic, Spices, Yogurt
description: Mutton Curry is a hearty and robust dish where tender pieces of mutton are slow-cooked in a spiced onion and tomato-based gravy. The deep flavors and tender meat make it a comfort food favorite, especially when paired with rice or roti.
steps: Heat oil in a pressure cooker. Add whole spices (bay leaf, cinnamon, cloves).; Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.; Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until aromatic.; Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Add yogurt and mix well.; Add mutton pieces, salt, and spices (turmeric, chili powder, garam masala). Mix thoroughly.; Cook on high heat for 5 minutes, then add water and pressure cook for 5-6 whistles.; Simmer the curry to desired consistency and garnish with fresh coriander.; Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: fish fry
ingredients: Fish, Spices, Lemon, Rice Flour, Ginger, Garlic
description: Fish Fry is a crispy and delicious dish where fish fillets are marinated in a blend of spices and herbs, coated in rice flour, and shallow-fried until golden. The result is a dish that is crunchy on the outside and tender inside, perfect as a starter or side dish.
steps: Clean the fish and pat dry. Marinate with lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, and spices (turmeric, chili powder, salt).; Let it rest for 20 minutes to absorb the flavors.; Coat the marinated fish pieces in rice flour evenly.; Heat oil in a pan and shallow-fry the fish on medium heat until crispy and golden brown on both sides.; Remove excess oil using a paper towel and serve hot with lemon wedges and salad.

name: chicken korma
ingredients: Chicken, Yogurt, Cream, Spices, Almonds, Onions
description: Chicken Korma is a luxurious dish made with chicken cooked in a rich and creamy gravy of yogurt, cream, and ground almonds. Flavored with aromatic spices, this mildly spiced curry is perfect for special occasions or festive meals.
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices (turmeric, chili powder, garam masala). Set aside for 1 hour.; Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown. Blend into a paste with almonds.; Add whole spices (cardamom, cloves) to the pan and sauté briefly.; Add marinated chicken and cook until partially done.; Stir in the onion-almond paste and cook for 10 minutes.; Add cream and simmer until chicken is tender and the gravy is rich.; Garnish with chopped almonds and serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Masala dosa
ingredients: Rice, Urad Dal, Potatoes, Onions, Mustard Seeds, Curry Leaves, Turmeric, Salt, spices
description: Masala Dosa is a crispy and savory pancake made from fermented rice and lentil batter, filled with spiced potato filling. It's a staple South Indian breakfast loved across the country.
steps: Soak rice and urad dal separately for 6 hours. Grind them into a smooth batter and let it ferment overnight.; Boil potatoes, peel, and mash them. Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and chopped onions. Sauté until onions are golden brown.; Add turmeric, mashed potatoes, and salt. Mix well to prepare the filling.; Heat a dosa tawa (griddle), pour a ladleful of batter, and spread it thinly in a circular motion.; Drizzle oil around the edges and cook until the dosa turns golden and crispy.; Place the potato filling in the center and fold the dosa. Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

name: aloo paratha
ingredients: Wheat Flour, Potatoes, Cumin Seeds, Coriander Powder, Red Chili Powder, Butter
description: Aloo Paratha is a stuffed Indian flatbread made with whole wheat flour and filled with a spicy mashed potato mixture. It's served with yogurt, pickle, or butter.
steps: Boil potatoes, peel, and mash them. Add cumin seeds, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt to make the filling.; Knead wheat flour into a soft dough and let it rest for 30 minutes.; Divide the dough into equal portions and roll each portion into a small circle.; Place the potato filling in the center, fold the edges, and roll it into a flat paratha.; Heat a tawa, place the paratha on it, and cook on both sides until golden brown. Apply butter while cooking.; Serve hot with yogurt or pickle.

name: samosa
ingredients: Potatoes, Green Peas, Cumin Seeds, Coriander, Garam Masala, Flour, Oil
description: Samosa is a popular Indian snack, consisting of a crispy triangular pastry filled with spiced potatoes and peas, deep-fried to golden perfection.
steps: Prepare the dough by mixing flour, salt, and oil. Add water gradually to make a stiff dough. Let it rest for 30 minutes.; Boil and mash potatoes. Sauté cumin seeds in oil, then add green peas, mashed potatoes, garam masala, and coriander. Mix well for the filling.; Divide the dough into small balls, roll each into a thin circle, and cut in half to make a cone.; Fill the cone with potato mixture, seal the edges with water, and shape into a triangle.; Deep fry the samosas in hot oil until golden and crisp. Serve with chutney.

name: pav bhaji
ingredients: Potatoes, Mixed Vegetables, Butter, Pav Bhaji Masala, Pav (bread rolls)
description: Pav Bhaji is a spicy mashed vegetable curry served with butter-toasted bread rolls. It's a popular street food in India, loved for its rich flavors and textures.
steps: Boil potatoes and mixed vegetables (like carrots, peas, and cauliflower) until soft. Mash them well.; Heat butter in a pan, sauté chopped onions until golden brown, and add chopped tomatoes. Cook until soft.; Add pav bhaji masala, chili powder, and mashed vegetables. Mix well and simmer for 10 minutes.; Butter the pav (bread rolls) on a tawa and toast until golden.; Serve the bhaji with buttered pav, chopped onions, and lemon wedges.

name: quiche lorraine
ingredients: Eggs, Cream, Bacon, Cheese, Spinach, Onion, Pie Crust
description: Quiche Lorraine is a classic French savory tart with a creamy custard filling, crispy bacon, melted cheese, and onions, baked in a flaky pie crust.
steps: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Roll out the pie crust and place it in a tart pan. Prick the base with a fork and blind bake for 10 minutes.; Cook bacon until crispy, then sauté onions and spinach in the same pan.; Whisk eggs and cream together, season with salt and pepper.; Layer the cooked bacon, onions, spinach, and cheese in the pie crust.; Pour the egg mixture over the fillings and bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the filling is set and golden.; Cool slightly before serving.

name: falafel
ingredients: Chickpeas, Onion, Garlic, Parsley, Cilantro, Cumin, Coriander, Baking Powder, Flour
description: Crispy, deep-fried chickpea balls, a popular street food in the Middle East.
steps: Soak the chickpeas overnight, then drain.; Blend chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, coriander, baking powder, and flour.; Shape the mixture into small balls.; Deep fry the falafel until golden and crispy.; Serve with tahini or in pita bread with vegetables.

name: banh mi
ingredients: Baguette, Pork, Pickled Vegetables, Cilantro, Cucumber, Jalapenos, Mayo
description: A Vietnamese sandwich made with a crispy baguette and savory fillings like pork, pickled vegetables, and fresh herbs, offering a combination of flavors and textures.
steps: Marinate pork with soy sauce, garlic, sugar, and pepper.; Grill or fry the marinated pork until cooked through.; Slice the baguette lengthwise and spread a layer of mayo.; Layer grilled pork, pickled vegetables, cucumber, cilantro, and jalapenos inside the baguette.; Serve fresh, optionally adding more hot sauce.

name: paella
ingredients: Rice, Saffron, Shrimp, Mussels, Chicken, Peas, Bell Peppers
description: A traditional Spanish rice dish with saffron, seafood, and vegetables, cooked in one pan. Known for vibrant colors and rich flavors.
steps: Sauté onions and bell peppers in oil until soft.; Add rice and toast lightly, then add saffron and chicken broth.; Add remaining vegetables and proteins, simmering without stirring.; Add seafood (shrimp, mussels) in the last 10-15 minutes of cooking.; Serve with lemon wedges and fresh parsley.

name: dim sum
ingredients: Pork, Shrimp, Dumpling Wrappers, Mushrooms, Soy Sauce, Ginger
description: Small bite-sized portions of food, often served in bamboo baskets, including dumplings and buns. It's a Cantonese dish traditionally served with tea.
steps: Mix ground pork, shrimp, soy sauce, ginger, and mushrooms for the filling.; Place the filling in each dumpling wrapper and fold into a pleated shape.; Steam the dumplings in a bamboo steamer for 10-15 minutes until fully cooked.; Serve with soy sauce or your favorite dipping sauce.

name: shrimp scampi
ingredients: Shrimp, Garlic, Butter, Lemon, Parsley, Olive Oil, Linguine
description: A flavorful pasta dish made with shrimp, garlic, butter, and a splash of lemon, creating a rich and savory sauce.
steps: Cook linguine pasta in salted boiling water until al dente.; In a large pan, heat olive oil and sauté garlic until fragrant.; Add shrimp to the pan and cook until pink and opaque.; Stir in butter and lemon juice, letting it melt into the sauce.; Toss the cooked linguine into the pan, mixing it well with the shrimp and sauce.; Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with extra lemon wedges.

name: grilled salmon
ingredients: Salmon Fillets, Olive Oil, Garlic, Lemon, Dill, Salt, Pepper
description: Fresh salmon fillets grilled to perfection with a zesty lemon and garlic marinade, offering a smoky flavor and tender texture.
steps: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.; Mix olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, dill, salt, and pepper in a bowl.; Brush the salmon fillets with the marinade, ensuring they are well coated.; Grill the salmon fillets skin-side down for about 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through.; Serve the salmon with a wedge of lemon and a sprinkle of fresh dill.

name: clam chowder
ingredients: Clams, Cream, Onions, Potatoes, Celery, Butter, Thyme
description: A rich and creamy soup made with fresh clams, potatoes, and a touch of thyme, creating a comforting and savory dish.
steps: Chop onions, potatoes, and celery into small pieces.; In a large pot, melt butter and sauté onions and celery until softened.; Add diced potatoes and cook for a few minutes before adding clams and their juice.; Pour in the cream and bring the mixture to a simmer, cooking for 15-20 minutes until the potatoes are tender.; Season with thyme, salt, and pepper to taste.; Serve hot with a sprinkle of fresh parsley.

name: lobster rolls
ingredients: Lobster, Buns, Mayonnaise, Lemon, Celery, Butter
description: Sweet lobster meat mixed with mayonnaise and served in a soft bun, topped with butter, offering a rich and flavorful seafood treat.
steps: Cook the lobster meat by boiling or steaming it until fully cooked, then chop it into small chunks.; In a bowl, mix the lobster meat with mayonnaise, lemon juice, and finely chopped celery.; Butter the buns and toast them lightly on a griddle.; Fill the toasted buns with the lobster mixture and serve with extra lemon wedges.

name: fish tacos
ingredients: White Fish (like Cod), Corn Tortillas, Cabbage, Lime, Avocado, Sour Cream, Chili Powder
description: Crispy fish served in a soft tortilla with tangy slaw and a squeeze of lime, offering a delicious and fresh meal.
steps: Season the fish fillets with chili powder, salt, and pepper, then cook them in a pan with olive oil until crispy.; Shred the cabbage and toss with lime juice to create a fresh slaw.; Warm the corn tortillas on a griddle.; Assemble the tacos by placing the cooked fish in the tortillas, topping with slaw, avocado slices, and a drizzle of sour cream.

name: seared tuna
ingredients: Tuna Steaks, Sesame Seeds, Soy Sauce, Ginger, Garlic, Olive Oil
description: Perfectly seared tuna steaks coated with sesame seeds and served with a soy and ginger sauce, offering a fresh and savory flavor.
steps: Coat the tuna steaks with sesame seeds on both sides.; Heat olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat.; Sear the tuna steaks for 1-2 minutes per side, depending on desired doneness.; In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, minced garlic, and grated ginger for the sauce.; Serve the seared tuna with the soy-ginger sauce on top.

name: paella de mariscos
ingredients: Shrimp, Mussels, Clams, Squid, Rice, Saffron, Bell Peppers, Tomatoes
description: A seafood version of the traditional Spanish paella, featuring a variety of shellfish and saffron rice, creating a fragrant and flavorful dish.
steps: Sauté bell peppers and tomatoes in olive oil until softened.; Add rice and cook for a few minutes, then add saffron and warm seafood broth.; Add the shellfish (shrimp, mussels, clams, and squid) and let it cook, avoiding stirring.; Simmer until the rice is fully cooked and the shellfish has opened up.; Serve with lemon wedges and garnish with fresh herbs.

name: oysters Rockefeller
ingredients: Oysters, Spinach, Breadcrumbs, Parmesan Cheese, Garlic, Butter, Herbs
description: Fresh oysters topped with a rich spinach and breadcrumb mixture, then baked until golden and crispy, offering a delicious seafood appetizer.
steps: Shuck the oysters and place them on a baking tray.; In a pan, sauté garlic in butter and add spinach, cooking until wilted.; Mix spinach with breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, and chopped herbs.; Top each oyster with the spinach-breadcrumb mixture.; Bake the oysters at 375°F for 10-12 minutes, or until the topping is golden brown.

name: shrimp tempura
ingredients: Shrimp, Flour, Cornstarch, Egg, Cold Water, Soy Sauce
description: Crispy battered shrimp, deep-fried to perfection, often served with a soy-based dipping sauce, offering a light and crunchy texture.
steps: Peel and devein the shrimp, leaving the tails on.; In a bowl, mix flour, cornstarch, egg, and cold water to make a batter.; Dip the shrimp in the batter, then deep fry in hot oil until golden and crispy.; Serve with a soy-based dipping sauce or sweet chili sauce.

name: grilled shrimp skewers
ingredients: Shrimp, Olive Oil, Garlic, Lemon, Paprika, Cilantro, Skewers
description: Juicy shrimp marinated in garlic, lemon, and spices, then grilled on skewers for a smoky and flavorful dish.
steps: Marinate the shrimp with olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, paprika, and chopped cilantro for at least 30 minutes.; Thread the shrimp onto skewers.; Grill the skewers for 2-3 minutes per side until the shrimp are pink and cooked through.; Serve with extra cilantro and lemon wedges.

name: egg curry
ingredients: Eggs, Onions, Tomatoes, Ginger, Garlic, Cumin Seeds, Coriander Powder, Turmeric, Chili Powder, Garam Masala, Cilantro, Salt, Oil
description: A flavorful and comforting Indian curry made with boiled eggs cooked in a rich, spicy onion-tomato gravy infused with cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala. Garnished with fresh cilantro, this dish is typically served with rice or naan.
steps: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.; Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.; Add grated ginger and minced garlic, sauté for 2 minutes.; Add pureed tomatoes, turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates from the masala.; Add water to adjust gravy consistency and let it simmer for 5-7 minutes.; Add boiled eggs (cut in half or whole) into the curry. Cook for 5 minutes to soak the flavors.; Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh cilantro.; Serve with rice or naan.

name: pani puri
ingredients: Semolina, Flour, Potatoes, Chickpeas, Tamarind, Mint, Cilantro, Green Chilies, Cumin Powder, Chat Masala, Black Salt, Salt, Water
description: Pani Puri is a popular Indian street food where crispy hollow puris are filled with spiced potato and chickpea filling, then dipped into tangy and spicy mint-flavored water. Each bite is a burst of flavor and texture, making it a favorite snack.
steps: Mix semolina, flour, and salt. Knead into a smooth dough.; Roll dough into small balls and flatten. Deep fry in hot oil until crispy.; Mash boiled potatoes and mix with boiled chickpeas, cumin powder, black salt, and chat masala.; For the pani: Blend mint leaves, cilantro, green chilies, tamarind, cumin powder, chat masala, black salt, and salt with water.; Fill each puri with the potato-chickpea mixture and dip into the pani.; Serve immediately for a crunchy, flavorful experience.

name: rajma masala
ingredients: Kidney Beans, Onions, Tomatoes, Garlic, Ginger, Cumin Seeds, Garam Masala, Turmeric, Red Chili Powder, Coriander Powder, Cilantro, Salt, Oil
description: Rajma Masala is a comforting North Indian curry made with red kidney beans cooked in a spiced onion-tomato gravy. The creamy texture and rich flavors make it a perfect companion for steamed basmati rice, famously known as 'Rajma Chawal'.
steps: Soak kidney beans overnight and pressure cook them until soft.; Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.; Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.; Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 2 minutes.; Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates from the masala.; Add the cooked kidney beans and adjust the gravy by adding water. Let it simmer for 15 minutes.; Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh cilantro.; Serve with steamed basmati rice.

name: hummus
ingredients: Chickpeas, Tahini, Lemon Juice, Garlic, Olive Oil, Salt, Cumin
description: A classic Middle Eastern dip made from mashed chickpeas, tahini, and garlic.
steps: Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, olive oil, salt, and cumin until smooth.; Serve in a bowl and drizzle with olive oil.; Garnish with a sprinkle of paprika and parsley.; Serve with pita bread or vegetables.

name: chicken shawarma
ingredients: Chicken, Yogurt, Garlic, Lemon Juice, Olive Oil, Cumin, Paprika, Coriander, Cinnamon
description: A delicious grilled meat wrap, commonly served with a variety of toppings.
steps: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, and spices.; Grill the chicken until cooked through.; Slice the chicken and serve in pita bread with pickles, tomatoes, and tahini.; Top with garlic sauce or a drizzle of olive oil.

name: tabbouleh
ingredients: Parsley, Tomatoes, Cucumber, Onion, Bulgar Wheat, Olive Oil, Lemon Juice, Mint, Salt.
description: A refreshing salad made with parsley, tomatoes, cucumber, and bulgur wheat.
steps: Soak the bulgur wheat in warm water until soft.; Chop the parsley, tomatoes, cucumber, and onion.; Combine the bulgur with the chopped vegetables and mint.; Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice, and season with salt.; Toss well and serve chilled.

name: mujadara
ingredients: Rice, Lentils, Onions, Olive Oil, Cumin, Coriander, Salt, Pepper
description: A simple yet flavorful dish made with rice, lentils, and caramelized onions.
steps: Cook the lentils until soft.; In a pan, fry the onions in olive oil until golden brown.; Cook rice in a separate pot.; Combine the cooked rice, lentils, and caramelized onions.; Season with cumin, coriander, salt, and pepper, then serve.

name: kebabs
ingredients: Ground Beef or Lamb, Onion, Garlic, Cumin, Paprika, Salt, Pepper, Parsley, Olive Oil
description: Grilled meat skewers, often served with pita and vegetables.
steps: Mix ground meat with grated onion, garlic, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.; Shape the mixture into kebab shapes on skewers.; Grill the kebabs until browned and cooked through.; Serve with a side of grilled vegetables and pita bread.

name: kofta
ingredients: Ground Beef or Lamb, Onion, Garlic, Cumin, Paprika, Parsley, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
description: Seasoned ground meat shaped into balls or patties, then grilled or fried.
steps: Mix ground meat with onion, garlic, cumin, paprika, parsley, salt, and pepper.; Shape into small balls or patties.; Grill or fry the kofta until cooked through.; Serve with tahini, yogurt, or a salad.

name: baklava
ingredients: Phyllo Dough, Walnuts, Pistachios, Butter, Sugar, Honey, Cinnamon, Lemon Juice
description: A sweet, flaky pastry filled with nuts and drenched in honey syrup.
steps: Layer phyllo dough in a baking pan, brushing each layer with melted butter.; Sprinkle the mixture of chopped walnuts and pistachios between layers.; Cut the pastry into diamond shapes and bake until golden.; Prepare a syrup with sugar, honey, and lemon juice, then pour over the hot baklava.

name: knafeh
ingredients: Shredded Phyllo Dough, Sweetened Cheese, Butter, Sugar, Rose Water, Pistachios
description: A rich, sweet dessert made with cheese and crispy pastry, soaked in syrup.
steps: Melt butter and coat the shredded phyllo dough.; Layer the dough in a pan and bake until golden.; Spread sweetened cheese in the middle and bake again.; Soak the hot knafeh with a syrup made from sugar and rose water.; Garnish with pistachios and serve.

name: stuffed grape leaves
ingredients: Grape Leaves, Rice, Onion, Tomato, Pine Nuts, Lemon Juice, Olive Oil, Herbs
description: Grape leaves stuffed with a flavorful rice mixture, commonly served as an appetizer.
steps: Soften grape leaves by boiling them briefly.; Prepare the rice mixture with onion, tomato, pine nuts, lemon juice, olive oil, and herbs.; Stuff the grape leaves with the rice mixture and roll tightly.; Place the rolls in a pot and cook with olive oil and lemon juice.; Serve warm or chilled.

name: chicken mandi
ingredients: Chicken, Basmati Rice, Onions, Garlic, Tomatoes, Yogurt, Spices (Cumin, Coriander, Cinnamon, Cloves, Cardamom), Saffron, Raisins, Cashews, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
description: A traditional Arabian rice dish with tender chicken, fragrant spices, and basmati rice.
steps: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, garlic, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, salt, and pepper.; Cook the onions in olive oil until soft, then add tomatoes and cook until they break down.; Add the marinated chicken and cook until browned.; Add water and bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer until the chicken is fully cooked.; In a separate pot, cook the basmati rice with saffron and some of the cooking liquid from the chicken.; Serve the chicken over the rice, garnished with raisins and cashews.

name: mutton mandi
ingredients: Lamb, Basmati Rice, Onions, Garlic, Tomatoes, Yogurt, Spices (Cumin, Coriander, Cinnamon, Cloves, Cardamom), Saffron, Raisins, Cashews, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
description: A hearty and flavorful Mandi made with tender lamb and aromatic spices, served with rice.
steps: Marinate the lamb with yogurt, garlic, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, salt, and pepper.; Cook the onions in olive oil until golden, then add tomatoes and cook until soft.; Add the marinated lamb to the pot and brown on all sides.; Add water and bring to a boil, then simmer until the lamb is tender.; Cook the basmati rice separately with saffron and some of the lamb cooking liquid.; Serve the lamb over the rice, garnished with raisins and cashews.

name: veg mandi
ingredients: Basmati Rice, Carrots, Potatoes, Cauliflower, Peas, Onions, Garlic, Tomatoes, Yogurt, Spices (Cumin, Coriander, Cinnamon, Cloves, Cardamom), Saffron, Raisins, Cashews, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
description: A vegetarian version of the traditional Mandi, filled with spiced vegetables and served with fragrant rice.
steps: Cook the onions in olive oil until soft, then add garlic and tomatoes.; Add diced carrots, potatoes, cauliflower, and peas, and cook for a few minutes.; Add spices such as cumin, coriander, cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom.; Add water and bring the mixture to a boil, then simmer until the vegetables are tender.; Cook basmati rice with saffron and some of the vegetable cooking liquid.; Serve the spiced vegetables over the rice, garnished with raisins and cashews.

name: Fish Mandi
ingredients: Fish Fillets (such as Kingfish or Grouper), Basmati Rice, Onions, Garlic, Tomatoes, Yogurt, Spices (Cumin, Coriander, Cinnamon, Cloves, Cardamom), Saffron, Raisins, Cashews, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
description: A flavorful Mandi with tender fish fillets, spiced rice, and a rich tomato-based sauce.
steps: Marinate the fish fillets with yogurt, garlic, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, salt, and pepper.; Cook the onions in olive oil until golden, then add tomatoes and cook until soft.; Add the marinated fish to the pan and cook gently until the fish is tender.; In a separate pot, cook the basmati rice with saffron and some of the fish cooking liquid.; Serve the fish over the rice, garnished with raisins and cashews.

name: mandi chicken makdous
ingredients: Chicken, Makdous (stuffed eggplant), Basmati Rice, Onions, Garlic, Tomatoes, Yogurt, Spices (Cumin, Coriander, Cinnamon, Cloves, Cardamom), Saffron, Raisins, Cashews, Olive Oil, Salt, Pepper
description: A unique version of Mandi with chicken and flavorful makdous (stuffed eggplant), creating a delicious fusion dish.
steps: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, garlic, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, salt, and pepper.; Cook the onions in olive oil until golden, then add tomatoes and cook until soft.; Add the marinated chicken to the pan and cook until browned.; Stuff the chicken with makdous (stuffed eggplant) and cook together.; Cook the basmati rice separately with saffron and some of the chicken cooking liquid.; Serve the chicken and makdous over the rice, garnished with raisins and cashews.

name: vada pav
ingredients: Potatoes, Green Chilies, Garlic, Ginger, Turmeric, Gram Flour, Curry Leaves, Pav Buns, Tamarind Chutney, Green Chutney, Dry Garlic Chutney, Oil, Salt
description: A spicy potato fritter sandwiched in a pav bun, served with chutneys.
steps: Boil and mash potatoes. Mix with turmeric, curry leaves, green chilies, garlic, and ginger.; Shape the mixture into balls.; Prepare a batter with gram flour, water, salt, and turmeric.; Dip the potato balls in the batter and deep fry until golden brown.; Toast pav buns with butter.; Assemble by placing the fritter in the bun with tamarind, green, and dry garlic chutneys.; Serve hot with fried green chilies.

name: bhel puri
ingredients: Puffed Rice, Sev, Onions, Tomatoes, Boiled Potatoes, Tamarind Chutney, Green Chutney, Coriander Leaves, Chaat Masala, Salt, Lemon Juice
description: A tangy and crispy snack made with puffed rice, chutneys, and spices.
steps: Mix puffed rice, sev, chopped onions, tomatoes, and boiled potatoes in a large bowl.; Add tamarind chutney, green chutney, chaat masala, salt, and lemon juice.; Garnish with coriander leaves and mix well.; Serve immediately to retain the crispiness.

name: kathi roll
ingredients: Wheat Flour, Chicken (or Paneer), Onions, Capsicum, Green Chilies, Yogurt, Spices (Turmeric, Garam Masala, Cumin), Eggs, Chaat Masala, Coriander Leaves, Oil, Salt
description: A delicious wrap filled with spiced chicken or paneer and veggies.
steps: Prepare a dough with wheat flour and water. Roll it into flatbreads.; Cook the chicken (or paneer) with onions, capsicum, yogurt, and spices until tender.; Cook the flatbread on a tawa and brush with beaten egg on one side.; Add the filling, sprinkle chaat masala, and roll tightly.; Serve hot with green chutney.

name: chicken pakoda
ingredients: Chicken, Gram Flour, Rice Flour, Ginger-Garlic Paste, Red Chili Powder, Turmeric, Coriander Powder, Garam Masala, Salt, Curry Leaves, Green Chilies, Oil for Frying
description: A crispy and spicy Indian snack made with marinated chicken, coated in a flavorful batter and deep-fried to golden perfection.
steps: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces and marinate with ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Let it rest for 30 minutes.; In a bowl, mix gram flour, rice flour, and a pinch of salt. Add curry leaves and chopped green chilies.; Add the marinated chicken to the flour mixture and coat well. Sprinkle water if needed to make the coating stick.; Heat oil in a deep pan. Fry the chicken pieces in small batches until golden and crispy.; Serve hot with mint chutney or ketchup.

name: Chocolate Cake
ingredients: Flour, Sugar, Cocoa Powder, Eggs, Butter
description: A delicious chocolate cake recipe.
steps: 1. Mix ingredients. 2. Bake at 180°C for 30 mins.

name: Classic Cheeseburger
ingredients:
500g ground beef
1 egg
Salt and pepper to taste
4 burger buns
4 slices of cheddar cheese
Lettuce, tomato, onion, and pickles (optional)
Ketchup and mustard
description: A juicy beef patty, melted cheese, and fresh toppings served in a soft bun—America's all-time favorite!
steps:
Prepare the Patty:
Mix ground beef, egg, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Shape into 4 patties.
Cook the Patty:
Heat a grill or pan over medium heat. Cook patties for 4–5 minutes per side until browned. Add cheese on top and let it melt.
Assemble the Burger:
Toast the buns. Add lettuce, tomato, patty with cheese, onion, and pickles. Top with ketchup and mustard.
Serve:
Close the bun and serve hot.

name: BBQ Ribs
ingredients:
1 rack of pork ribs
2 cups barbecue sauce
1 tbsp salt
1 tbsp black pepper
1 tbsp garlic powder
1 tbsp paprika
description: Tender, smoky ribs coated with a rich barbecue sauce—perfect for grilling lovers.
steps:
Prepare the Ribs:
Remove the membrane from the back of the ribs. Rub with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika.
Bake:
Wrap the ribs in foil and bake at 150°C (300°F) for 2.5 hours.
Grill:
Unwrap the ribs and brush with barbecue sauce. Grill for 10–15 minutes until caramelized.
Serve:
Slice and serve with extra barbecue sauce.

name: Buffalo Wings
ingredients:
12 chicken wings
1 cup all-purpose flour
1 tsp salt
1 tsp paprika
1 cup hot sauce (like Frank’s RedHot)
1/2 cup butter
description: rispy fried chicken wings coated in spicy buffalo sauce, served with blue cheese dressing.
steps:
Prepare the Wings:
Mix flour, salt, and paprika. Coat the wings in the flour mixture.
Fry:
Heat oil in a deep pan. Fry wings for 10–12 minutes until golden and crispy.
Make the Sauce:
Melt butter and mix with hot sauce. Toss the wings in the sauce.
Serve:
Serve with blue cheese dressing and celery sticks.

name: Mac and Cheese
ingredients:
250g elbow macaroni
2 cups milk
2 tbsp butter
2 tbsp flour
2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
1/2 cup breadcrumbs
description: A creamy, cheesy pasta dish baked to perfection—a comfort food classic!
steps:
Cook the Pasta:
Boil macaroni in salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Make the Sauce:
Melt butter in a pan, add flour, and stir for 2 minutes. Slowly add milk, whisking until thickened. Add cheese and mix until smooth.
Combine and Bake:
Mix the cheese sauce with pasta. Pour into a baking dish, sprinkle with breadcrumbs, and bake at 180°C (350°F) for 20 minutes.
Serve:
Serve warm and enjoy!

name: Apple Pie
ingredients:
6 medium apples (peeled and sliced)
1 cup sugar
1 tsp cinnamon
1/4 tsp nutmeg
2 tbsp flour
1 tbsp lemon juice
1 pack of pie crust (top
description: A sweet, flaky pie filled with spiced apples—a symbol of American tradition.
steps:
Prepare the Filling:
Mix apples, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, flour, and lemon juice in a bowl.
Assemble the Pie:
Place one pie crust in a pie pan. Add the apple mixture. Cover with the second crust and seal the edges. Cut small slits on top for steam.
Bake:
Bake at 200°C (400°F) for 45–50 minutes until golden brown.
Serve:
Let it cool and serve with vanilla ice cream.

name: Fried Chicken
ingredients:
For the Chicken:
1 kg chicken pieces (drumsticks, thighs, wings)
2 cups buttermilk (or substitute with 2 cups milk + 1 tbsp vinegar or lemon juice)
1 tsp salt
1/2 tsp black pepper
1/2 tsp paprika (for mild heat and color)
For the Coating:
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 tsp garlic powder
1 tsp onion powder
1 tsp paprika
1/2 tsp cayenne pepper (optional, for a spicier flavor)
1 tsp salt
1/2 tsp black pepper
For Frying:
Vegetable oil (for deep frying)
description: Southern-style fried chicken is a true comfort food, known for its golden, crunchy crust and tender, juicy interior. It’s traditionally marinated in buttermilk for extra flavor and moisture, then coated with a seasoned flour mixture and deep-fried to perfection.
steps:
Step 1: Marinate the Chicken
Clean and pat dry the chicken pieces with a paper towel.
In a large bowl, mix buttermilk, salt, pepper, and paprika.
Add the chicken pieces to the bowl, ensuring they are fully submerged in the buttermilk. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours (overnight for the best results). This step helps tenderize the chicken and adds flavor.
Step 2: Prepare the Seasoned Flour
In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, cayenne pepper (if using), salt, and black pepper.
Mix well to ensure the spices are evenly distributed in the flour. This will be your crispy coating.
Step 3: Coat the Chicken
Remove the chicken pieces from the buttermilk marinade. Let the excess buttermilk drip off.
Dredge each piece in the seasoned flour, pressing lightly to ensure the flour sticks. Shake off excess flour and place the coated chicken on a plate.
For an extra-crispy coating, you can repeat this process by dipping the chicken back into the buttermilk and coating it in the flour again.
Step 4: Fry the Chicken
Heat oil in a deep pan or fryer to 175°C (350°F). Make sure there’s enough oil to fully submerge the chicken.
Fry the chicken in batches. Avoid overcrowding the pan to maintain the oil temperature.
Cook each piece for 10–12 minutes, turning occasionally, until golden brown and crispy. The internal temperature should reach 75°C (165°F) when tested with a meat thermometer.
Transfer the fried chicken to a wire rack or paper towels to drain the excess oil.
Step 5: Serve and Enjoy
Serve the fried chicken hot with your favorite dipping sauces like ranch, honey mustard, or barbecue sauce. It pairs well with mashed potatoes, coleslaw, or cornbread for a full Southern meal.

name: Crispy Fried Chicken
ingredients: Chicken, Flour, Spices, Oil,cheese
description: Golden crispy fried chicken with spices.
steps: Mix flour and spices, coat chicken, and fry.

name: Spicy Mango Coconut Pasta
ingredients: Pasta, Mango, Coconut Milk, Olive Oil, Garlic, Onion, Chili Flakes, Salt, Coriander
description: A tropical fusion pasta blending sweet mango, creamy coconut milk, and a touch of spice for a refreshing and unique flavor.
steps: Boil pasta until al dente. In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté garlic and onion. Add chili flakes, then stir in mango puree and coconut milk. Simmer for 3–4 minutes. Toss in the pasta, mix well, and garnish with coriander before serving.

name: parata
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 cup warm water, 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, Ghee or butter for frying
description: A flaky and layered unleavened flatbread from the Indian subcontinent, perfect for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.
steps:
1. In a large bowl, combine the flour and salt.
2. Gradually add the warm water and 1 tablespoon of oil, mixing until a soft dough forms.
3. Knead the dough for 5-7 minutes until smooth and elastic.
4. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for at least 30 minutes.
5. Divide the dough into 6-8 equal-sized balls.
6. Roll each ball into a thin circle (about 6-8 inches in diameter).
7. Brush the circle with melted ghee or butter.
8. Make a slit from the center to the edge of the circle.
9. Starting from the slit, roll the dough into a cone shape.
10. Tuck the end of the cone under itself to form a spiral shape.
11. Flatten the spiral gently with your fingers.
12. Roll the flattened spiral into a 6-8 inch circle again, ensuring it remains layered.
13. Heat a flat griddle or pan over medium heat.
14. Cook each paratha for 1-2 minutes per side, or until golden brown spots appear.
15. Brush with ghee or butter while cooking for a richer flavor and flakier texture.
16. Serve hot with your favorite curry, yogurt, or chutney.

name: masala
ingredients: 2 tablespoons coriander seeds, 1 tablespoon cumin seeds, 1 tablespoon black peppercorns, 1 teaspoon cardamom pods, 1 teaspoon cloves, 1 teaspoon cinnamon stick, broken into pieces, 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg, grated, 1/2 teaspoon dried red chili flakes (or more, to taste), 1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder
description: A fragrant and flavorful Indian spice blend, perfect for curries, stews, and marinades.
steps:
1. In a dry skillet, toast the coriander seeds, cumin seeds, peppercorns, cardamom pods, cloves, and cinnamon stick over medium heat for 2-3 minutes, or until fragrant and slightly darkened, shaking the pan frequently to prevent burning.
2. Remove the spices from the heat and let them cool completely.
3. Once cooled, grind the toasted spices in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle until finely ground.
4. Add the nutmeg and turmeric powder to the ground spice mixture and mix well.
5. Store the masala in an airtight container in a cool, dark place for up to 6 months.

name: wada
ingredients: 1 cup urad dal (split black lentils), soaked overnight, 1 inch ginger, grated, 2 green chilies, finely chopped, 1 sprig curry leaves, finely chopped, 1/4 teaspoon asafoetida (hing), Salt to taste, Oil for deep frying
description: Updated by Admin AI
steps:
1. Drain the soaked urad dal and grind it to a smooth, thick paste using very little water.
2. Transfer the batter to a bowl and add ginger, green chilies, curry leaves, asafoetida, and salt. Mix well.
3. Heat oil in a deep frying pan or kadhai over medium heat.
4. Wet your hands and take a small portion of the batter. Shape it into a round disc with a hole in the center (like a donut).
5. Gently slide the wada into the hot oil.
6. Fry the wadas until golden brown and crispy, flipping occasionally.
7. Remove the wadas from the oil and drain them on a paper towel.
8. Serve hot with chutney or sambar.

name: coffee
ingredients: 1 cup freshly brewed hot coffee, 1-2 teaspoons sugar (or sweetener of choice), 1 tablespoon milk or cream (optional), 3-5 clean, ordinary house keys (sterilized, preferably stainless steel), Pinch of cinnamon (optional)
description: A whimsical and unexpected beverage infused with the essence of possibilities. This coffee is sure to unlock your inner potential (or at least give you a caffeine boost with a metallic tang).
steps:
1. Ensure keys are thoroughly cleaned and sterilized. Boiling them for 5 minutes is recommended.
2. Pour hot coffee into your favorite mug.
3. Add sugar or sweetener to taste, stirring until dissolved.
4. Gently drop the cleaned keys into the coffee.
5. Add milk or cream, if desired.
6. Let the keys steep in the coffee for 1-2 minutes, allowing their essence to infuse the drink.
7. Remove the keys (carefully, they will be hot!) and set them aside.
8. Sprinkle with a pinch of cinnamon (optional).
9. Enjoy your key-infused coffee responsibly. Do not swallow the keys.

name: poori
ingredients:
Okay, here are the ingredients for poori, with measurements:

*   **Wheat Flour (Atta):** 1 cup
*   **Water:** ¼ - ½ cup (as needed)
*   **Salt:** ¼ teaspoon
*   **Oil/Ghee:** 1 teaspoon (optional, for dough)
*   **Oil:** For deep frying
description: Golden, puffed delights! Fry these unleavened Indian breads until they're airy and perfect for dipping in your favorite curries.
steps:
Here's a step-by-step guide to making perfect Pooris:

**Ingredients You'll Need:**

*   2 cups whole wheat flour (atta)
*   1/2 teaspoon salt
*   1 tablespoon oil (for the dough)
*   Water (as needed, lukewarm)
*   Oil for deep frying

**Preparation Steps:**

1.  **Combine Dry Ingredients:** In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour and salt. Mix well.

2.  **Add Oil and Mix:** Add 1 tablespoon of oil to the flour mixture. Rub the oil into the flour with your fingertips until the flour feels slightly moist and holds its shape when pressed. This helps to create a crispier poori.

3.  **Add Water Gradually:** Start adding lukewarm water little by little, mixing it into the flour. Knead the dough well, adding water until it comes together into a firm, non-sticky dough.  The dough should be tighter than a chapati dough.

4.  **Knead the Dough:** Knead the dough for 5-7 minutes. This develops the gluten and makes the pooris puff up better. The dough should be smooth and elastic.

5.  **Rest the Dough:** Cover the dough with a damp cloth or a lid and let it rest for at least 15-20 minutes.  Resting the dough allows the gluten to relax, making it easier to roll out.

6.  **Prepare for Rolling:** Divide the dough into small, equal-sized portions (about 1 inch in diameter). Roll each portion into a smooth ball.

7.  **Roll Out the Pooris:** On a lightly floured surface (or using a rolling board), gently roll out each dough ball into a small, circular disc. Aim for a diameter of about 3-4 inches.  Keep the thickness even – not too thick, not too thin.  If the dough sticks, lightly dust with flour.

8. **Heat the Oil:** While you are rolling the pooris, heat enough oil in a deep frying pan (kadai) or wok over medium-high heat. The oil should be hot enough to cook the pooris quickly and allow them to puff up. Test the oil by dropping a tiny piece of dough into it. If it rises to the surface quickly and sizzles, the oil is ready.

9.  **Fry the Pooris:** Gently slide a rolled-out poori into the hot oil.

10. **Puffing Up:** As soon as the poori starts to float on the surface, gently press it down with a slotted spoon or spatula. This encourages it to puff up fully.

11. **Cook Until Golden:** Fry the poori until it is golden brown on both sides. Turn it over once or twice to ensure even cooking. This will take about 1-2 minutes per side.

12. **Drain and Serve:** Remove the fried poori from the oil using a slotted spoon and place it on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb excess oil.

13. **Repeat:** Repeat steps 7-12 with the remaining dough balls.

14. **Serve Hot:** Serve the pooris hot with your favorite side dishes, such as potato curry, chana masala, or raita.

Enjoy your delicious homemade Pooris!

name: butter dosa
ingredients:
Okay, here are the ingredients for butter dosa:

*   **Dosa Batter:** (Follow a standard dosa batter recipe)
    *   **Urad Dal (Split Black Lentils):** 1 cup
    *   **Idli Rice (Parboiled Rice):** 3 cups
    *   **Fenugreek Seeds (Methi):** 1 tsp
*   **Butter:** As needed for cooking
*   **Oil (Optional):** Small amount for initial greasing of the pan (some prefer only butter)
description:
Crispy, golden dosa perfection, drenched in buttery goodness - a South Indian delight you won't be able to resist!
Melt-in-your-mouth crispy dosa, kissed with butter - a simple indulgence that elevates the classic to a new level.
steps:
Okay, here are the step-by-step instructions for making butter dosa:

**Step 1: Prepare the Dosa Batter (Ideally, do this a day in advance)**

1.  **Soak the Rice and Lentils:** In a large bowl, combine 3 cups of raw rice (dosa rice or regular rice), 1 cup of urad dal (split black lentils, skinned), and 1 teaspoon of fenugreek seeds. Wash them thoroughly 2-3 times until the water runs clear.
2.  **Soak Separately (Optional):** You can also soak 1/2 cup of poha (flattened rice) separately for 30 minutes before grinding. This helps make the dosa softer.
3.  **Soak in Water:** Add enough fresh water to completely cover the rice and lentils.  Soak for at least 4-6 hours, or preferably overnight (8-10 hours). The longer the soak, the better the fermentation.
4.  **Grind the Rice and Lentils:** Drain the soaked rice and lentils. Add them to a grinder or blender in batches. Use the soaking water to grind, adding only enough to create a smooth, flowing batter.  Grind until you achieve a fine, smooth consistency.  The batter should be slightly thick but pourable. If using poha, add it during the last batch and grind until incorporated.
5.  **Combine and Ferment:** Pour the ground batter into a large bowl. Add salt to taste (usually about 1-2 teaspoons). Mix very well with your hand (this helps with fermentation due to the warmth).
6.  **Ferment the Batter:** Cover the bowl loosely and let it ferment in a warm place for 8-12 hours or until the batter has doubled in volume and has a slightly sour aroma.  The fermentation time will vary depending on the temperature.

**Step 2: Prepare the Dosa Making Area**

7.  **Prepare Ingredients:** Have the dosa batter ready.  Have butter readily available (cubed for easier application). Have a small bowl of water for adjusting the pan temperature.  Have a clean, damp cloth or paper towels.
8.  **Heat the Pan:** Place a flat, non-stick tawa (griddle) or frying pan over medium-high heat.  The pan needs to be hot enough for the dosa to cook properly but not so hot that it burns immediately.

**Step 3: Make the Butter Dosa**

9.  **Check Pan Temperature:** Sprinkle a few drops of water on the hot tawa. If the water sizzles and evaporates quickly, the pan is ready. If the water just sits there, the pan is not hot enough. If the water splatters violently and burns off immediately, the pan is too hot.
10. **Grease the Pan Lightly (First Dosa Only):** Lightly grease the pan with a small amount of oil or ghee (clarified butter) for the first dosa to ensure it doesn't stick.  This may not be necessary with a well-seasoned non-stick pan.
11. **Pour the Batter:** Lower the heat to medium.  Using a ladle, pour one ladleful of batter onto the center of the hot tawa.
12. **Spread the Batter:** Immediately use the back of the ladle to spread the batter in a circular motion, starting from the center and moving outwards, to form a thin, even circle.
13. **Add Butter:** Immediately after spreading the batter, place small cubes of butter around the edges and in the center of the dosa. The amount of butter depends on how rich you want it to be.
14. **Cook the Dosa:** Cook the dosa for 2-3 minutes, or until the bottom turns golden brown and the edges start to lift from the pan.
15. **Flip (Optional):** For a crispier dosa, you can flip it over and cook for another minute on the other side.  This is optional; some people prefer to only cook one side.
16. **Fold or Roll:** Use a spatula to gently loosen the dosa from the pan. Fold it in half or roll it up.
17. **Serve Immediately:** Serve the butter dosa hot with sambar, chutney (coconut chutney, tomato chutney, etc.), and/or podi (gunpowder).

**Step 4: Repeat**

18. **Clean the Pan (If Needed):** After each dosa, you may need to quickly wipe the pan with a clean, damp cloth or paper towel to remove any excess batter or residue. This helps prevent the subsequent dosas from sticking or burning.
19. **Adjust Heat:** Adjust the heat as needed to maintain a consistent cooking temperature.
20. **Repeat:** Repeat steps 11-17 to make the remaining dosas.

**Tips for Success:**

*   **Batter Consistency:** The batter consistency is crucial. If it's too thick, the dosa will be thick and pancake-like. If it's too thin, it will be difficult to spread.
*   **Pan Temperature:** Maintaining the right pan temperature is key.
*   **Fermentation:** Proper fermentation is essential for a light and airy dosa.
*   **Fresh Butter:** Use good quality butter for the best flavor.
*   **Practice:** Making dosas takes a little practice. Don't be discouraged if your first few attempts aren't perfect.

Enjoy your homemade butter dosa!

name: butter naan
ingredients:
Ingredients:
(All-purpose flour)
(Yeast)
(Sugar)
(Salt)
(Baking powder)
(Plain yogurt)
(Milk)
(Oil)
(Butter)
(Water)
description: Description: Fluffy, buttery, and irresistibly delicious – homemade naan bread that's easier than you think! Perfect for scooping up your favorite curries and stews.
steps:
Steps:
1. Mix flour, yogurt, baking powder, baking soda, sugar, and salt in a bowl.
2. Add warm water gradually and knead to form a soft, pliable dough.
3. Add oil and knead for another 5-7 minutes until smooth.
4. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for at least 2 hours.
5. Divide the dough into equal-sized balls.
6. Roll each ball into an oval or teardrop shape.
7. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium-high heat.
8. Place the rolled naan on the hot tawa.
9. Cook for 1-2 minutes until bubbles start to appear.
10. Flip the naan and cook the other side for another 1-2 minutes until lightly golden brown spots appear.
11. If using an oven, carefully place the tawa with the naan under a preheated broiler (high heat) for a few seconds until it puffs up and gets slightly charred (optional).
12. Remove the naan from the tawa.
13. Brush generously with melted butter.
14. Serve hot.

name: butter roti
ingredients:
Ingredients:
Whole wheat flour (atta)
Water
Salt
Ghee or butter
description:
Description:
Flaky, buttery, and utterly irresistible: these rotis are pure comfort food, ready in minutes!
steps:
Steps:
1. Combine whole wheat flour (atta), salt, and a teaspoon of oil or ghee in a bowl.
2. Gradually add warm water while kneading to form a soft, pliable dough.
3. Knead the dough for 5-7 minutes until smooth and elastic.
4. Cover the dough with a damp cloth or lid and let it rest for at least 30 minutes.
5. Divide the dough into small, equal-sized balls.
6. On a lightly floured surface, roll out each ball into a thin, circular roti.
7. Heat a flat griddle or tawa over medium-high heat.
8. Place the rolled-out roti on the hot tawa.
9. Cook for about 30-45 seconds on each side, or until small bubbles start to appear.
10. Flip the roti and cook the other side similarly.
11. Using tongs or a clean cloth, gently puff up the roti directly over the flame (or on the tawa).
12. Once the roti is puffed and cooked through, remove it from the heat.
13. Spread butter generously on the hot roti.
14. Serve immediately.

name: shawarma
ingredients:
Ingredients:
(Meat)
(Pita bread)
(Tahini sauce)
(Hummus)
(Pickled vegetables)
(Tomatoes)
(Cucumbers)
(Onions)
(Lettuce)
(Spices)
description: Description: Craving that authentic Middle Eastern street food flavor? Tender, marinated meat roasted to perfection, then shaved and piled high – get ready for a shawarma feast!
steps:
Steps:
1. Marinate meat (chicken, beef, or lamb) in a blend of spices (cumin, coriander, paprika, turmeric, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, cinnamon, cardamom), lemon juice, vinegar, and olive oil for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight.
2. Stack marinated meat onto a vertical rotisserie spit, ensuring it is tightly packed and balanced.
3. Cook the meat on the vertical rotisserie, slowly rotating, under a heat source (gas or electric) until the outer layer is browned and cooked through.
4. Shave thin slices of cooked meat from the rotating spit using a long knife.
5. Warm pita bread or lavash.
6. Prepare desired toppings: sliced tomatoes, onions, pickles, lettuce, parsley, and sauces (tahini, garlic sauce, hummus).
7. Spread sauce on the warm pita bread.
8. Add a generous portion of shaved shawarma meat to the pita.
9. Add your preferred toppings.
10. Wrap the shawarma tightly, folding in the bottom.
11. Optionally, press the wrapped shawarma on a panini press or grill to crisp the bread.
12. Serve immediately.

name: gongura
ingredients:
Ingredients:
Gongura leaves
Onions
Green chilies
Red chilies
Ginger-garlic paste
Mustard seeds
Cumin seeds
Fenugreek seeds
Turmeric powder
Red chili powder
Oil
Salt
Asafoetida
description:
Description:
Tangy and fiery, Gongura awakens your taste buds with its unique sour leaf flavor and a spicy kick! This Andhra delicacy is a must-try.
steps:
Steps:
1. Wash gongura leaves thoroughly in several changes of water to remove dirt and sand.
2. Separate leaves from thick stems.
3. Boil gongura leaves in a pot of water until they are soft and wilted.
4. Drain the cooked gongura leaves and let them cool slightly.
5. Grind the cooked gongura leaves into a coarse paste using a blender or food processor.
6. Heat oil in a pan or kadai.
7. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and dried red chilies to the hot oil and let them splutter.
8. Add chopped onions, garlic, and green chilies to the pan and saute until golden brown.
9. Add the ground gongura paste to the pan.
10. Add turmeric powder, salt, and any other desired spices (like coriander powder) to the pan.
11. Cook the gongura mixture, stirring frequently, until the oil separates from the sides.
12. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves (optional).
13. Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: nuggets
ingredients:
Ingredients:
(Chicken)
(Flour)
(Breadcrumbs)
(Egg)
(Milk)
(Salt)
(Pepper)
(Garlic Powder)
(Paprika)
(Oil)
description:
Description:
Craving a quick bite? Unlock bite-sized culinary secrets with these delicious recipe nuggets!
steps:
Steps:
1. Thaw nuggets if frozen.
2. Preheat oven or air fryer according to package directions.
3. Place nuggets in a single layer on a baking sheet or in the air fryer basket.
4. Cook according to package directions, flipping halfway through if necessary.
5. Check internal temperature to ensure nuggets are fully cooked.
6. Let cool slightly before serving.
7. Serve with desired dipping sauces.

name: bread
ingredients:
Ingredients:
Flour
Water
Yeast
Salt
description: Description: Sink your teeth into golden, homemade perfection. This bread recipe delivers a soft, satisfying loaf that's perfect for sandwiches or simply slathered with butter.
steps:
Steps:
1. Gather ingredients: flour, water, yeast, salt.
2. Activate yeast: mix yeast with warm water and a pinch of sugar. Let sit for 5-10 minutes until foamy.
3. Combine dry ingredients: In a large bowl, mix flour and salt.
4. Add wet ingredients: Pour activated yeast mixture into the dry ingredients.
5. Mix: Combine wet and dry ingredients until a shaggy dough forms.
6. Knead: Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 8-10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
7. First rise: Place dough in a lightly oiled bowl, turning to coat. Cover and let rise in a warm place for 1-1.5 hours, or until doubled in size.
8. Punch down: Gently punch down the dough to release air.
9. Shape: Shape the dough into desired loaf form (round, oblong, etc.).
10. Second rise: Place shaped dough in a prepared baking pan. Cover and let rise for 30-60 minutes, or until almost doubled.
11. Preheat oven: Preheat oven to appropriate temperature (usually 375-450°F).
12. Bake: Bake for specified time (usually 20-35 minutes) or until golden brown and internal temperature reaches around 200°F.
13. Cool: Remove bread from pan and let cool completely on a wire rack before slicing and serving.

name: Veg Fried Rice
ingredients: Rice, Vegetables, Soy Sauce, Salt
description: Delicious veg fried rice with veggies
steps: Cook rice, fry veggies, mix and serve
